files.description: Implements centralized comparison utilities supporting absolute/relative tolerances, per-field overrides, NaN/Inf handling, structured results, and rich mismatch reporting for benchmark outputs.
Defines the benchmark contract schema (including per-observable tolerance specifications) and provides loaders/validators to ensure each task declares required metadata and tolerance choices.

Runs benchmarks end-to-end, loads each task contract, executes candidate and reference algorithms, and enforces standardized comparisons using the centralized utilities with CI-friendly failure output.
Provides unit tests for comparison behavior including absolute/relative tolerance logic, per-field overrides, NaN/Inf policies, shape/type checking, and deterministic mismatch messages.
Validates that the benchmark runner refuses missing/invalid tolerance documentation and correctly applies contract-defined tolerances when determining pass/fail.
Documents the tolerance policy, NaN handling rules, and a per-observable table template plus guidance for justifying tolerance choices for each v0.1 task.
Configures CI to run the benchmark runner and the test suite, failing the build on any contract validation error or comparison mismatch.

missionDescription: Implement centralized comparison utilities (absolute/relative tolerances, per-field tolerances, NaN handling) and enforce them in the benchmark runner and CI; add documentation of tolerance choices per observable.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Makes numeric tolerance + determinism a first-class benchmark feature (rather than ad hoc), enabling scalable addition of new observables and comparison across methods/truncations without constant exp...
